alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 1:34AM EDT until April 08 at 6:22PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey...including the following county...Morris. * WHEN...Until 645 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 133 AM EDT, flooding continued across portions of the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - For Whippany River at Morristown: At 1:10am the stage was 6.53 feet. Flood Stage is 6 feet. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 35 and 39. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
